title: Thursday 2AM SGT
commentary: Silver's parabolic run extends — the white metal surges 4.8% to $84.60, now up 162% YoY as the precious metals mania accelerates despite dollar stability. Crypto remains in the penalty box with BTC at $66.5K (-4.7%) and ETH at $1,931 (-5.3%), extending this week's brutal risk-off unwind. Dow defended record highs above 50.2K on strong labor data — ADP private payrolls doubled estimates at 130K, unemployment dropped to 4.3% — while AI chip stocks ripped (Micron, TI, Lam +5% each) and software names got crushed on AI displacement fears (Salesforce, ServiceNow -5%). Oil ticked up 1.4% to $64.88 as geopolitical premium builds.

title: Thursday 1AM SGT
commentary: Crypto carnage deepens further — Bitcoin craters to $66K (-5.1%) and ETH plunges to $1,914 (-5.5%) as digital assets extend their brutal week-long selloff. Precious metals continue their divergent rally: gold breaks $5,100 (+1.4%) hitting fresh highs while silver surges 3.9% to $83.50. Oil rallies 2% to $65.20 as Iran tensions trump a huge US inventory build. US equities mixed — Dow flat at 50.2K, S&P barely green (+0.2%), Russell small caps bleeding -1% as risk rotation favors commodities over tech.

title: Thursday Midnight SGT
commentary: Crypto carnage deepens — Bitcoin plunges 3.9% to $66.5K while ETH tumbles 4.6% to $1,930, the worst session this week as digital assets extend their risk-off bleed. Silver refuses to quit, surging another 3% to $83 as precious metals continue their dollar-weakness-fueled rampage. Oil jumps 1.4% to $65 as US-Iran tensions simmer with warships massing in the Gulf. US equities flat-lining post-CPI — Dow slips below 50K (-0.40%), S&P treads water (+0.03%), Nasdaq drifts lower (-0.13%). DXY slides to 97 as dollar bears maintain control.

title: Wednesday 11PM SGT
commentary: Commodities rage as crypto bleeds — silver rockets +3.65% to $83 while oil surges 2.8% on supply tightness, extending the hard assets rally. US equities grind higher (S&P +0.46%, Dow +0.34%) with VIX crushed to 17.07 (-4%) signaling peak complacency despite 10Y yields ticking up to 4.18%. Bitcoin and Ethereum in freefall (-2.75% and -3.46% respectively) as digital assets decouple from the risk-on rotation into real assets.

title: Asia Evening
commentary: Silver explodes 4.6% to $84 as precious metals defy dollar strength, with gold climbing 1.1% past $5,085. Crypto bleeds red—Bitcoin down 2.8% at $67K, Ethereum tumbles 3.5%. US equities mixed: Dow ekes out gains while tech drags Nasdaq lower by 0.6%. Oil rallies 2.2% on supply tightness. Japan's Nikkei leads Asia with a 2.3% surge.

title: Wednesday 5AM SGT — Crypto Extends Recovery as CPI Day Begins, Dow Hits Fresh Record
commentary: Crypto's pre-CPI bounce accelerated with ETH surging +5.52% to $2,010 and BTC rallying +2.88% to $68,777 as risk appetite returns ahead of today's pivotal inflation print. Dow pushed to a fresh record at 50,270 (+0.27%) while tech lagged with Nasdaq -0.55% and S&P 500 -0.24%, reflecting rotation into defensive megacaps as chip stocks consolidate. Silver's brutal correction extended to -2.81% at $81.02, now down over $40 from its January $121 peak, while gold defended the $5,030 psychological floor (-0.57%). DXY flat at 96.86 after last week's dollar massacre — all eyes on CPI to validate the three Fed cuts now priced for 2026.

title: Wednesday 4AM SGT — Crypto Rebounds as Dollar Weakness Accelerates, CPI Day Arrives
commentary: Crypto staged a solid bounce with ETH surging +5.46% to $2,015 and BTC rallying +2.78% to $68,994, reversing this week's risk-off bleed as digital assets finally catch a bid ahead of today's CPI print. Dollar index slipped further to 96.80 after weak December retail sales sealed the deal on a more dovish Fed — markets now pricing three rate cuts in 2026 versus two a week ago, with China's Treasury warning adding fuel to the fire. Precious metals remained under pressure with silver extending its brutal correction (-2.56% to $81.23), now down over $40 from its late-January $121 peak, while gold held near $5,028 (-0.62%) defending the psychological floor. Equities treading water into CPI — S&P 500 flat at 6,963, Dow edging to fresh records — as the inflation print will either validate or demolish the rate cut narrative.

title: Wednesday 3AM SGT — Silver Extends Correction to -2.2%, Markets Drift Pre-CPI
commentary: Silver's brutal correction deepened to -2.18% at $80.44, now down over $40 from its January $121 peak as the speculative unwind continues ahead of today's CPI print — gold followed suit at -0.84% to $5,037, slipping toward the $5K psychological floor. US equities treading water with S&P 500 -0.19%, Dow -0.02%, and Nasdaq -0.30% as traders refuse to commit before inflation data drops. VIX crept up +2.25% to 17.75, the highest reading this week, signaling mounting nervousness but no panic. Nikkei continues outperforming at +2.28%, riding yen weakness as the JPY index rose +0.90% — Japan's export-heavy stocks still catching a bid while the rest of Asia consolidates.

title: Wednesday 2AM SGT — ETH Tanks -4.3%, Silver Slides as Pre-CPI Risk-Off Intensifies
commentary: Ethereum led the risk-off exodus, dumping -4.27% to $2,036 — its worst session this week — while BTC held relatively better at -1.30% ($69,764), signaling crypto bears are targeting altcoins into today's CPI print. Silver's brutal correction extended to -2.67% at $81.14, now down nearly 33% from its late-January $121 peak as the speculative frenzy unwinds. Gold eased -0.66% to $5,026 but held above the psychological $5K floor as China's central bank extends its 15-month gold buying streak. DXY flat at 96.84 after last week's -2% slide, with markets pricing three Fed cuts in 2026 after December retail sales stalled and China warned institutions to trim US Treasury holdings — dollar bears still in control but taking a breather.

title: Wednesday 1AM SGT — Silver's Slide Deepens, ETH Tanks -3.4% as CPI Looms
commentary: Silver's correction accelerated to -2.52% at $80.16, shedding nearly $4 from this week's highs as precious metals profit-taking intensifies ahead of today's CPI print — gold followed lower at -0.63% to $5,047. Ethereum took the biggest hit of the night, dumping -3.37% to $2,023 while BTC held relatively better at -0.97% ($69,317), with crypto now firmly in risk-off mode as inflation data anxiety grips markets. US equities barely moved — Dow +0.57% to 50,420, S&P 500 flat at 6,969, Nasdaq -0.09% — as traders refused to commit ahead of the CPI catalyst. Nikkei extended its rally (+2.28% to 57,650) bucking the cautious global tone, while VIX crept up +0.46% to 17.44 signaling nervousness without panic.
